channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report X-2023100699
item.description:
Report X-2023100699

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded from trailer when we noticed the outer packaging was wet. The package was places into a plastic lines tote and separated from all other packages for inspection. DescribePack: Small leak at the base of the jerrican in the seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic lined tote and separated from other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023100779
item.description:
Report X-2023100779

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE LOOKED WET UPON OPENING THE TRAILER DOOR. A RESPONDER WAS CALLED IMMEDIATELY AND THE A SMALL AMMOUNT OF RESIDUE WAS CLEANED UP OFF OF THE FLOOR ALONG WITH THE PACKAGE. AFTER OPENING THE PACKAGE, THE RESPONDER NOTICED A SMALL PUNCTURE HOLE.

item.title: Report X-2023081973
item.description:
Report X-2023081973

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: LE MARS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GBRX 703543 was found leaking in Merrill, IA. Upon inspection GBRX 703542 was found leaking from the Bottom Outlet Valve secondary cap. The BNSF Responder inspected GBRX 703547 BOV and determined the BOV ball valve was defective allowing ethanol to leak past the ball valve seat. The BNSF Responder tool tightened the secondary BOV closure cap to stop the release.
